newsitem.title: USA: ConEd sees Indian Pt 2 back to grid Friday.
newsitem.headline: ConEd sees Indian Pt 2 back to grid Friday.

text.p: Consolidated Edison Co of New York said Friday its 975 megawatt (MW) Indian Point 2 nuclear power plant will likely connect to the grid this afternoon.
"We're at three percent power right now, and we should be back sometime this afternoon," said company spokesman Joan Burger.
"As of now we think it was a valve malfunction that allowed for the high level in the steam generator," she said.
The unit first tripped off line Monday during an electrical equipment failure, triggering a week-long series of snags preventing the unit from coming back on line.
Indian Point is located along the Hudson River about 50 miles north of New York City.
